name: aa
discharge_summary: Patient admitted for Chronic Kidney Disease (Stage 3). Managed with fluid balance, anti-hypertensives and adjustment of diabetes medications where applicable. Renal function stabilized; patient discharged in stable condition.
recommendations: Continue medications, follow dietary sodium and protein restrictions, monitor urine output and serum creatinine. Follow up with Nephrology.

name: Meera Verma
discharge_summary: Patient treated for Acute Kidney Injury (Pre-renal) with correction of precipitating factors and renal supportive care. Renal parameters improved before discharge.
recommendations: Maintain hydration as advised, avoid NSAIDs, repeat renal function tests in follow-up. Follow up with Nephrology.

name: Riya Bhatia
discharge_summary: Patient treated for Acute Kidney Injury (Intrinsic) with correction of precipitating factors and renal supportive care. Renal parameters improved before discharge.
recommendations: Maintain hydration as advised, avoid NSAIDs, repeat renal function tests in follow-up. Follow up with Nephrology.

name: Diya Patel
discharge_summary: Patient treated for Nephrotic Syndrome with steroids/immunosuppression and diuretics as indicated. Edema reduced and proteinuria decreased at discharge.
recommendations: Adhere to prescribed immunosuppression and diuretics, monitor weight and urine output. Follow up with Nephrology.

recommendations: Continue medications as prescribed and return for follow-up or earlier if new symptoms arise.

name: Rahul Yadav
discharge_summary: Patient managed for Renal Calculi (Kidney Stones) with analgesia, hydration and stone clearance where required. Pain controlled and patient tolerating oral intake.
recommendations: Increase oral fluids, strain urine, return if severe pain or fever. Follow up with Nephrology/Urology.

name: Diya Nair
discharge_summary: Post transplant follow-up; immunosuppressant regimen optimized. No evidence of rejection at discharge.
recommendations: Strict adherence to immunosuppressants, regular blood tests for drug levels and renal function. Immediate contact if fever or graft pain. Follow up with Transplant/Nephrology.
